main event: A yellow-orange, half moon-shaped object, the size of a basketball, was observed falling over Resolution Island, Canada.
interesting points: The object was visible for 2 minutes during the observation., The object appeared to be falling at the time of the sighting., The conclusion drawn by observers indicated that the object was likely the planet Saturn., Witnesses described the object as bright and yellow-orange during nighttime., The weather conditions during the sighting were reported as clear and calm.
witness description: average observers from the 290th Aircraft Control and Warning Squadron, USAF
